body:
Is this a bug report or feature request?
* Bug Report

**Bug Report**

What happened:
The docs still contain `versionTag` field in the Cluster CRD.

What you expected to happen:
The docs with Cluster CRDs to not contain the removed field `versionTag`.

How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):
```
> grep -riI versionTag 
tests/framework/installer/install_data.go:  versionTag: master
design/upgrade.md:1. The cluster administrator updates their Rook Cluster CRD to update the `versionTag` field using a command similar to `kubectl -n rook edit cluster.rook.io rook`
design/upgrade.md:1. The Rook operator receives the `update` event for the Cluster CRD instance and sees that the `versionTag` field has changed from its previous value.
design/resource-constraints.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/upgrade.md:  versionTag: v0.5.0
Documentation/upgrade.md:The first step in the upgrade process is to update the Cluster spec's `versionTag` field.
Documentation/upgrade.md:In your editor, simply update `versionTag: v0.5.0` to now be `versionTag: v0.5.1`, then save and quit your editor.
Documentation/cluster-crd.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/cluster-crd.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/cluster-crd.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/cluster-crd.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/cluster-crd.md:  versionTag: master
Documentation/kubernetes.md:  versionTag: master
PendingReleaseNotes.md:- Removed the `versionTag` property. The container version to launch in all pods will be the same as the version of the operator container.
```

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): N/A
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): N/A
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: N/A
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): N/A
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): N/A
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): N/A
* Ceph status (use `ceph health` in the [Rook toolbox](https://Rook.io/docs/Rook/master/toolbox.html)): N/A

/cc @travisn
title: versionTag still in documentation even though it got removed
